IRPact_modellierung.events

Class EventScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • IRPact_modellierung.SimulationEntity
      • IRPact_modellierung.events.EventScheduler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContinuousEventScheduler, DiscreteEventScheduler

    public abstract class EventScheduler
extends SimulationEntity
    Abstraction of an event scheduler. Keeps an ordered list of events to be executed and offers functionality for accessing them. Scheduling and construction is left to the implementation of concrete schedulers.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • scheduledEvents

        protected java.util.LinkedList<Event> scheduledEvents

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventScheduler

        public EventScheduler(SimulationContainer associatedSimulationContainer)
        Initiates the list of scheduled events and adds the scripted events to this list. The (scheduling) order of the scripted events should be established in the constructor of the implementation or the implementation should overwrite the scheduleScriptedEvents method
        Parameters:
        associatedSimulationContainer - The simulation container in which the simulation takes place

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleEvent

        public void scheduleEvent(Event eventToSchedule)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Schedules a new event. Will generally put the event in the list based on its temporal order; However details are left to the implementation of schedulers.
        Parameters:
        eventToSchedule - The event that is to be scheduled
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when event has been scheduled before or is scheduled for the past

      • pushEvent

        public void pushEvent(Event eventToSchedule)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Schedules a new event. Will generally put the event in the list based on its temporal order; However details are left to the implementation of schedulers. Method is basically an alias to scheduleEvent and only used for consistency with other methods
        Parameters:
        eventToSchedule - The event that is to be scheduled
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when event has been scheduled before or is scheduled for the past

      • scheduleValidEvent

        protected abstract void scheduleValidEvent(Event evenToSchedule)
        Pushes a (valid) event (i.e. not scheduled before and not lying in the past) in the event list. How this is done exactly depends on the implementation.
        Parameters:
        evenToSchedule - The event that is to be scheduled

      • popNextEvent

        public Event popNextEvent()
                   throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        pops (removes and returns) the event scheduled next. Assumes that the next scheduled event is the first element in the list. With implementations that violate this assumption, the element returned might not the 'next' (in the sense of temporal order) element
        Returns:
        The first entry of the list of scheduled events (generally the next event)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Will be thrown when the list of scheduled events is empty

      • topNextEvent

        public Event topNextEvent()
        Method to retrieve the next event is scheduled. Assumes that the next scheduled event is the first element in the list. With implementations that violate this assumption, the element returned might not the 'next' (in the sense of temporal order) element Unlike pop the element is not taken off the list, so it should be used to get information about the event, but not to execute the event, since otherwise an event might be executed multiple times.
        Returns:
        The first entry of the list of scheduled events (generally the next event)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Will be thrown when the list of scheduled events is empty

      • existsNextEvent

        public boolean existsNextEvent()
        Method to check whether a next event is present (whether the list is not empty).
        Returns:
        Will return true if the list is not empty, false if so.

      • everScheduledEvent

        public boolean everScheduledEvent(Event eventToCheck)
        Method to check if an event was ever an event scheduled by the EventScheduler. All events scheduled are kept in an event set. This method will check for membership of the eventToCheck within this set.
        Parameters:
        eventToCheck - Event to check whether it ever existed (within this EventScheduler in this simulation)
        Returns:
        True if event was ever scheduled by this EventScheduler, false if not.
